Annotation.String: Storage defines a storage subsystem and its respective properties. A storage subsystem represents a set of storage controllers (physical or virtual) and the resources such as volumes that can be accessed from that subsystem.
This resource shall be used to represent resources that represent a storage subsystem in the Redfish specification.
Storage can be updated to change AssetTag and other writable properties.
This schema defines a storage controller and its respective properties. A storage controller represents a storage device (physical or virtual) that produces Volumes.
This resource shall be used to represent a resource that represents a storage controller in the Redfish specification.
The encryption key to set on the storage subsytem.
This parameter shall contain the encryption key to set on the storage subsystem.
This action is used to set the encryption key for the storage subsystem.
This action shall set the encryption key for the storage subsystem.

This schema defines a storage subsystem and its respective properties. A storage subsystem represents a set of storage controllers (physical or virtual) and the resources such as volumes that can be accessed from that subsystem.
This resource shall be used to represent resources that represent a storage subsystem in the Redfish specification.
The set of storage controllers represented by this resource.
A collection that indicates all the storage controllers that this resource represents.
The set of drives attached to the storage controllers represented by this resource.
A collection that indicates all the drives attached to the storage controllers that this resource represents.
The set of volumes produced by the storage controllers represented by this resource.
A collection that indicates all the volumes produced by the storage controllers that this resource represents.
Contains references to other resources that are related to this resource.
The Links property, as described by the Redfish Specification, shall contain references to resources that are related to, but not contained by (subordinate to), this resource.
The available actions for this resource.
The Actions property shall contain the available actions for this resource.
This property describes the status and health of the resource and its children.
This property shall contain any status or health properties of the resource.
Redundancy information for the storage subsystem.
This property shall contain redundancy information for the storage subsystem.
Contains references to other resources that are related to this resource.
This type, as described by the Redfish Specification, shall contain references to resources that are related to, but not contained by (subordinate to), this resource.
An array of references to the chassis to which this storage subsystem is attached.
The value of this property shall reference a resource of type Chassis that represents the physical containers attached to this resource.
The available actions for this resource.
This type shall contain the available actions for this resource.
This property contains the available OEM specific actions for this resource.
This property shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.
The available OEM specific actions for this resource.
This type shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.
This property describes the status and health of the resource and its children.
This property shall contain any status or health properties of the resource.
The maximum speed of the storage controller's device interface.

The value of this property shall represent the maximum supported speed of the Storage bus interface (in Gigabits per second). The interface specified connects the controller to the storage devices, not the controller to a host (e.g. SAS bus, not PCIe host bus).
The firmware version of this storage Controller.
This property shall contain the firwmare version as defined by the manufacturer for the associated storage controller.
This is the manufacturer of this storage controller.

The value of this property shall be the name of the organization responsible for producing the storage controller. This organization might be the entity from whom the storage controller is purchased, but this is not necessarily true.
This is the model number for the storage controller.
The value of this property shall be the name by which the manufacturer generally refers to the storage controller.
This is the SKU for this storage controller.
The value of this property shall be the stock-keeping unit number for this storage storage controller.
The serial number for this storage controller.
The value of this property shall be a manufacturer-allocated number used to identify the storage controller.
The part number for this storage controller.
The value of this property shall be a part number assigned by the organization that is responsible for producing or manufacturing the storage controller.
The user assigned asset tag for this storage controller.
The value of this property shall be an identifying string used to track the storage controller for inventory purposes.
This represents the protocols by which this storage controller can be communicated to.
The value of this property shall be the set of protocols this storage controller can be communicated to.
This represents the protocols which the storage controller can use to communicate with attached devices.
The value of this property shall be the set of protocols this storage controller can use to communicate with attached devices.
The Durable names for the storage controller.
This property shall contain a list of all known durable names for the associated storage controller.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to remove the Nullable facet on NavigationProperties of type Collection.

This version was created to change references to Identifier to be its abstract base type, to add an abstract definition of StorageController, and to deprecate the versioned definition of Protocol to use an unversioned definition. It was also created to add requirements on the action parameters to show they are mandatory via Nullable=false. It was also created to correct the Descriptions and LongDescriptions used in the defined Actions.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation. It was also created to change the VolumeCollection reference to Swordfish.
Contains references to other resources that are related to this resource.
The Links property, as described by the Redfish Specification, shall contain references to resources that are related to, but not contained by (subordinate to), this resource.
Contains references to other resources that are related to this resource.
This type, as described by the Redfish Specification, shall contain references to resources that are related to, but not contained by (subordinate to), this resource.
An array of references to the endpoints that connect to this controller.
The value of this property shall be a reference to the resources that this controller is associated with and shall reference a resource of type Endpoint.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to remove the Nullable facet on NavigationProperties of type Collection.

This version was created to change references to Identifier to be its abstract base type, to add an abstract definition of StorageController, and to deprecate the versioned definition of Protocol to use an unversioned definition. It was also created to add requirements on the action parameters to show they are mandatory via Nullable=false. It was also created to correct the Descriptions and LongDescriptions used in the defined Actions.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation. It was also created to change the VolumeCollection reference to Swordfish.
The available actions for this resource.
The Actions property shall contain the available actions for this resource.
The available actions for this resource.
This type shall contain the available actions for this resource.
This property contains the available OEM specific actions for this resource.
This property shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.
The available OEM specific actions for this resource.
This type shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.

This version was created to change references to Identifier to be its abstract base type, to add an abstract definition of StorageController, and to deprecate the versioned definition of Protocol to use an unversioned definition. It was also created to add requirements on the action parameters to show they are mandatory via Nullable=false. It was also created to correct the Descriptions and LongDescriptions used in the defined Actions.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation. It was also created to change the VolumeCollection reference to Swordfish.
The name of the Storage Controller.
The value of this property shall be the name of the Storage Controller.

This version was created to move Protocols to its own CSDL file. It was also created to add requirements on the action parameters to show they are mandatory via Nullable=false. It was also created to correct the Descriptions and LongDescriptions used in the defined Actions.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation. It was also created to change the VolumeCollection reference to Swordfish.
The Location of the storage controller.
This property shall contain location information of the associated storage controller.
A reference to the Assembly resource associated with this Storage Controller.
The value of this property shall be a link to a resource of type Assembly.
An array of references to the StorageServices that connect to this controller.
The value of this property shall be a reference to the resources that this controller is associated with and shall reference a resource of type StorageService.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation. It was also created to change the VolumeCollection reference to Swordfish.
This object describes the cache memory of the storage controller in general detail.
This object shall contain properties which describe the cache memory for the current resource.
The PCIe interface details for this controller.
This object shall contain details on the PCIe interface used to connect this PCIe-based controller to its host.
This object describes the cache memory of the storage controller in general detail.
This type shall contain properties which describe the cache memory for a storage controller.
The total configured cache memory, measured in MiB.
This property shall contain the amount of configured cache memory as measured in mebibytes.
The portion of the cache memory that is persistent, measured in MiB.
This property shall contain the amount of cache memory that is persistent as measured in mebibytes. This size shall be less than or equal to the TotalCacheSizeMib.
This property describes the status and health of the resource and its children.
This property shall contain any status or health properties of the resource.
This version was created to make use of the new Revisions annotation. It was also created to change the VolumeCollection reference to Swordfish.
This object describes the RAID Types supported by the storage controller.
This object shall contain all the RAIDType values supported by the current resource.
